data.title: Pineapple Crispy Shrimp is divine!
data.text: A small, (10 - 12 table) family-run place with a "hole-in-the-wall" feel to it, but with a clean and enjoyable dining room.  We also love just getting take-out from them, and have tried most of their dishes with no bad experiences.  They have a Pineapple crispy shrimp dish that is amazing.  Highly recommended!

data.title: Finally, good Chinese food in Simi!
data.text: We don't have many options in Simi, but this is worth a visit.  Recommended my Chinese Acupuncturist.  We've tried a variety of items on the menu, and haven't been disappointed.  Space is limited and they often have issues going on with the bathroom.  Service is quick and the food is decent.  Price is average.

data.title: Super Szechuan
data.text: We are visiting from NYC and came here for dinner based on the Yelp reviews. This was some of the best Chinese food we have had. The "marriage" of flavors was incredible and the ingredients were super fresh. The staff was extremely helpful in recommending specific authentic dishes. The portions are plentiful.

data.title: Chinatown-quality food! That's a good thing!
data.text: Only eaten here a few times, but they have very good, authentic Chinese food.  They have a special Chinese menu for those of us who like the kind of food you can't get just anywhere (like the stuff you have to drive to Chinatown to get).  Be adventurous and give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

data.title: Saturday Lunch too much food to handle
data.text: If you order from the regular menu be prepared for a lot of food  this time ordered beef egg foo yovung and veggie mu shu from regular menu (not lunch or dinner specials) and 2 teas  had the mu shu entirely left over total $25 + tip  I had simi vally deal coupon so my net was $20  for 2 delicious meals and 2 more for dinner.  usually have lunch special for $6 or $7  which includes soup & salad entree and rice  good value and scrumptuous food  if you like hot their house specials will clear your sinuses!
